result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C Kirkham

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant Michael C Kirkham in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Michael C Kirkham.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Jeremy Bousman, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Galaviz.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:25 AM Defendant Michael C Kirkham in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Michael C Kirkham.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
